amendment.description: To reduce the bloated Pentagon budget by 10 percent and invest that money in jobs, education, health care, and housing in communities in the United States in which the poverty rate is not less than 25 percent.

vote.text: Amendment SA 1788, under the order of 7/2/20, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 23 - 77. Record Vote Number: 135.

action.text: Amendment SA 1788 proposed by Senator Sanders to Amendment SA 2301. (consideration: CR S4371-4375; text: CR S4371-4372) To reduce the bloated Pentagon budget by 10 percent and invest that money in jobs, education, health care, and housing in communities in the United States in which the poverty rate is not less than 25 percent.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 1788 proposed by Senator Sanders to Amendment SA 2301.

Senate amendment not agreed to: Amendment SA 1788, under the order of 7/2/20, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 23 - 77. Record Vote Number: 135.

Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 1788, under the order of 7/2/20, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 23 - 77. Record Vote Number: 135.
